study_sentences.text: Genomic profiling revealed a pathogenic fusion involving the EWSR1 gene characteristic of clear cell sarcoma.
High‑resolution MRI identified leptomeningeal melanocytosis with diffuse T1 hyperintensity along the cerebellar folia.
Histopathology demonstrated Rosai‑Dorfman disease with emperipolesis of histiocytes.
CT imaging showed dendriform pulmonary ossification presenting as branching calcific densities in the lung parenchyma.
MRI spectroscopy detected elevated taurine peaks in a medulloblastoma of the desmoplastic/nodular subtype.
Ultrasound elastography suggested hepatic involvement by fibrolamellar carcinoma featuring lamellar fibrosis.
PET‑CT uncovered hypermetabolism in a hemangiopericytoma seated at the cerebellopontine angle.
Whole‑body diffusion‑weighted MRI highlighted multifocal Langerhans cell histiocytosis with punched‑out skull lesions.
Cardiac MRI disclosed left ventricular noncompaction characterized by a noncompacted to compacted myocardial ratio exceeding 2.3.
Serial CT enterography demonstrated mural thickening and sacculations in jejunal segments typical of jejunal diverticulosis with pneumatosis cystoides intestinalis.
Endoscopic ultrasound‑guided biopsy confirmed solid pseudopapillary neoplasm of the pancreas harboring CTNNB1 mutation.
High‑resolution CT delineated pulmonary alveolar microlithiasis with diffuse sand‑like calcifications.
MR neurography revealed hourglass-like constriction of the suprascapular nerve implicating neuralgic amyotrophy.
CT urography showed a papillary tumor consistent with inverted papilloma of the renal pelvis.
Magnetic resonance venography demonstrated cerebral venous sinus thrombosis secondary to Behçet's disease.
MRI orbital study exhibited an expansile lesion with flow voids consistent with lymphangioma featuring intralesional hemorrhage.
Bone scintigraphy exhibited the 'hot skull' sign in polyostotic Paget disease involving the calvarium.
Dual‑energy CT characterized crystal deposition consistent with tophaceous pseudogout involving the atlantoaxial joint.
PET‑MRI illustrated hypermetabolic foci in myxoid/round cell liposarcoma with translocation t(12;16)(q13;p11).
Cone‑beam CT of the temporal bone depicted superior semicircular canal dehiscence with tympanic facial nerve aberrancy.
